key_points: Federal grants of more than $889 million and low-interest loans exceeding $816 million have been distributed for Hurricane Ida recovery in Louisiana.
$297 million has been paid in National Flood Insurance Program claims to survivors.
Assistance includes housing support, other needs assistance, and U.S. Small Business Administration loans for both individuals and businesses.
Federal housing assistance has provided rental aid to over 179,000 homeowners and renters.
Direct Temporary Housing assistance is offered in 10 of the most impacted parishes.
The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers has installed 33,200 "blue roofs" for temporary home roof repairs.
FEMA Disaster Recovery Centers have been visited by nearly 33,269 individuals seeking help.
Disaster Survivor Assistance teams have made over 143,544 home visits.
The deadline for applying for FEMA assistance has been extended to November 29, 2021.
Methods to apply for FEMA assistance include online applications and phone calls, which are available seven days a week.
